title: Add a "Date Last Updated" column on System Dates
custom_steps: On the System Dates screen, add a new â€œDate Last Updatedâ€� column on each section. Whenever a system date is updated, the column will display a timestamp and user who made the update. See attached:

title: As a BOC user I want to see a meaningful Report mode for the Generate Add C batch
custom_steps:
Currently the batch results are just returning the generic results which only tells you which players will get a C

Results will be updated to display:

player id

player name

org

add c type

yearly salary

AAA salary

AA salary

A+ salary

single A salary

rookie salary

Excel export should include all columns

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to Edit Notification Subscriptions for EBIS Users
custom_steps:
Wireframe: [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=notification_subscriptions|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=notification_subscriptions|smart-link] 

AC:

* After selecting an Org, a specific user, and the â€œViewâ€� button, a list of all notification buckets should appear
* Expanding each section should display the individual notifications that the user is subscribed to or not
* There will be an â€œEditâ€� button at the bottom of the screen
** Selecting to Edit will prompt the On/Off column to become editable toggles
** Selecting the Edit button will bring up Save and Cancel buttons in its place
* Selecting to Save will update any changes made to the selected userâ€™s notification subscriptions

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to view a new Notifications Subscriptions Screen
custom_steps:
Wireframe: [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=notification_subscriptions|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=notification_subscriptions|smart-link] 

AC:

* Under the Communications dashboard in the left navigation menu, there will be a â€œNotifications Subscriptionsâ€� tab
* The layout will match the provided wireframe
* Choosing an Org, a specific user, and selecting the â€œViewâ€� button will bring up all buckets of notification categories
** Selecting to expand these sections will show the individual notifications that the selected user is subscribed to
* Choosing an Org and to View All users will bring up a table that displays all users from the selected Org that are subscribed to any EBIS notifications
** The table should have the following columns:
*** Last
**** Userâ€™s last name
*** First
**** Userâ€™s first name
*** Username
**** Email associated with the EBIS account - clicking a user name will load that userâ€™s subscriptions
*** Notification Categories
**** The larger notification bucket that the user has subscriptions to
**** Note: Each listed category should appear as a link that upon clicking, should bring up a tooltip displaying the individual notifications within that category that the user is subscribed to - see attached

title: As a BOC Admin, I want Players who Sign pior to the 3A Championship Date to be credited with a year of Rule 5 Eligibility
custom_steps:
AC:

* If a player signs the first contract prior to the 3A Championship season date, the year will count towards their Rule 5 Eligibility
** If the player signs after their season ends, but prior to the 3A Championship season date, the year will count towards their Rule 5 Eligibility

title: Tech Debt - update the widget export to use screenshot printing rather than itext for PDF generation
custom_steps:
Now that we have a (better) option than itext we should generate widget export PDFâ€™s using our screenshot printing method.

We can clean up how they look as well, hopefully making the process a lot smoother.

title: As a League Econ user I want to see an indicator on the Major Contract Payroll tab that indicates when the contract contains a Valley Option
custom_steps: Currently when the payroll calc detects a valley option we generate a comment on the payroll indicating that.  Users have asked that we also include a database field and an indicator on the tab to indicate that the contract has a valley option.

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to see the Custom Notification History
custom_steps:
Wireframe: [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=custom_notifications|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=custom_notifications|smart-link] 

AC:

* There will be a History table at the bottom of the Custom Notifications screen
* After a custom notification is successfully sent, the notification will appear in the History table
* The table will consist of the following columns:
** Sent
*** Date, Time
** Title
** Body
** Sent By
** Sent To

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to Create & Send Custom Notifications through EBIS
custom_steps:
Wireframe: [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=custom_notifications|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=custom_notifications|smart-link] 

AC:

* Under the Communications dashboard in the left navigation menu, there will be a  â€œCustom Notificationsâ€� tab
* The page will be organized with the following required fields:
** Notification Title
*** Textbox
*** Up to 50 characters
** Notification Body
*** Large textbox
*** Up to 200 characters
** Send To
*** Dropdown:
**** All Users
**** Users in an Org
**** Users Subscribed to a Notification Category
**** Users with the Role
** (Depending on what is selected for â€œSend Toâ€�) - Org OR Category OR Role
*** Dropdown:
**** All MJ Orgs (multiple can be selected)
**** All Notification Categories (currently unknown)(multiple can be selected)
**** All User Roles (multiple can be selected)
* There will be a Send button that will be initially unclickable and grayed out
** Upon filling out the Sent To and Org OR Category OR Role, the Send button will become clickable
** Selecting the Send button will deliver the notification via EBIS to the selected users in the new High Priority tray

title: As an EBIS User, I want to Manage My Notification Subscriptions
custom_steps:
Wireframe: [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=my_notification_subscriptions|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=my_notification_subscriptions|smart-link] 

AC:

* Under the username dropdown menu on the top right of the screen, there will be a new â€œMy Notification Subscriptionsâ€� tab (see attached)
* The layout will match the provided wire
** There will be individual notifications under each section (currently unknown)
** Each section will display if the logged in user is subscribed the specific notification via an On/Off label
* Selecting the Edit button at the bottom will cause the On/Off labels to become toggles
** The logged in user will then be able to select which notifications they would like to receive
** Selecting to Save will save any changes made 
* High priority notifications cannot be unsubcribed from and instead of a toggle will display â€˜high priorityâ€™

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to manage User Notifications through EBIS
custom_steps:
Wire: [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=manage_notifications|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=manage_notifications|smart-link] 

AC:

* There will be an Edit button on the Manage Notifications dashboard, as depicted in the provided wire
* Clicking the Edit button will reload the page in edit mode
* A Save and Cancel button will be available to the user
** Clicking Save will commit the users changes and reload the page in View mode
** Clicking Cancel will prompt the user to confirm their choice
*** If they confirm, changes will be dismissed and the page will be reloaded in View mode

Note: If a notification does not have any of the three columns checked, it will effectively be turned off and not delivered anywhere

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to View a Manage Notifications Dashboard
custom_steps:
Wire: [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=manage_notifications|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=manage_notifications]

AC:

* Under the Communications dashboard in the left nav, there will be a â€˜Manage Notificationsâ€™ tab
* The layout will match the provided wire
** The individual sections on the page will reflect the notification buckets (currently unknown)
* Each section will contain a table that displays
** Notification Name
** High Priority
*** Notifications with this flag set will be delivered to subscribers High Priority Notifications tray
** Send to Slack
*** Notifications with this flag set will be delivered to appropriate slack channels
** Send to User Notifications
*** Notifications with this flag set will be delivered to subscribers notifications clipboard

title: As a EBIS User, I want to see High Priority Notifications in a tray
custom_steps:
Wire: [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=notifications_panel|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=notifications_panel|smart-link] 

AC:

* There will be a new Bell Icon in the top nav of all React EBIS screens as depicted in the wire
* Clicking the bell Icon will open the High Priority Notifications tray
* Inside the tray,
** There will be an 'X' icon to close the tray
** There will be a dropdown filter
*** This filter will default to â€˜All High Priority,â€™ which will show all notification buckets
*** Additional notification buckets will be added (currently unknown)
** There will be a â€˜Manage Subscriptionsâ€™ link
*** Clicking this will take the user to the 'Manage Subscriptions' page [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=my_notification_subscriptions|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=my_notification_subscriptions|smart-link] 
** There will be a â€˜See all notificationsâ€™ link (this page will be built in a future story)
*** Clicking this link will take the user to their Notifications Clipboard
